newsitem.title: POLAND: Optimus new share issue cleared.
newsitem.headline: Optimus new share issue cleared.

text.p: The Polish Securities Commission (KPW) has cleared a new issue of up to 2.5 million shares for computer maker Optimus SA, which would later be exchanged for the firm's convertible bonds, KPW said in a statement.
Optimus issued 300 of its five-year bonds, with a par value of $100,000 each in June, which can be converted into shares at any time before they mature on June 20, 2001.
Optimus earlier said one convertible bond would be exchangeable into 6,947 common shares at 38.76 zlotys a share.
The KPW also cleared two million registered Optimus shares for trade.
